content.description: Climbs cracks and sidepulls straight up pretty, steepening face with a crux fingerlock move at twenty-five feet. Start to the right for an easier approach to the crux. "Yeah buddy!"
content.location: About 1/2 mile from the bridge.

content.description: The middle of three routes. half crack half crimp. sweeps to the right to a landing where you can jump from. The Landing has a first level, a second slightly higher and a third more sketchy and higher landing if you so dare.
content.location: The Middle line of 3 (tri)  in a formation just past King Kong Rock on the right coming from the bridge.  you will have to look back as u pass a little cove. Pictured in power, King Kong Rock well looks like the face of Kong

content.description: Left most route of obvious 3 route rock. all crack till it runs out and then its find your own holds. this one does not have a nice landing to jump from like its other two partners Courage and wisdom
content.location: The left most line of 3 (tri)  in a formation just past King Kong Rock on the right coming from the bridge.  you will have to look back as u pass a little cove. Pictured here King Kong Rock well looks like the face of Kong

content.description: Start just around the aerate and immediately work your way to the main face but not to far as the first few feet are lay back with your body leaning right. get to the top of the first landing then jump or go to the second landing.  a Third if your brave
content.location: The right most line of 3 (tri)  in a formation just past King Kong Rock on the right coming from the bridge.  you will have to look back as u pass a little cove. Pictured in power, King Kong Rock well looks like the face of Kong

content.description: Fun route starts great on some fun holds with great feet then goes out to a left side pull and things start getting spicy.
content.location: Just after smearing tuna on your right heading up stream

content.description: There are a bunch of ways to get up to the roof and pull it straight under up the crack, easy face line on the right and up left the dyno or the big right traverse. You pick it they are all about v2.
content.protection: water kick off hard rocks are under the vertical part of this wall.
content.location: starting at the bridge heading back this will be on your right.

content.description: Staying on the arete the whole way will bring you ten ft up to your first very small left hand crimp. You must use this and a smear to throw to the slope on the arete and keep body tension as you stick and bump up every move on this climb start to finish gets progressively harder with the top out being the crux.
content.location: Just around the corner from Bear Claw

content.description: A fun slightly overhanging route with good holds throughout, an awesome sitting spot 10 feet up, and a scary roof finish. Try to avoid the left wall as much as possible, for a more fulfilling climb.
content.protection: Deep water. Start is right next to a heavily leaning slab. This continues down at the same angle, so falls are safe.
content.location: West side of the river/lake. 1.5 miles upstream just a little bit before Full Value. Just past Evinrude Crack on the opposite side.

content.description: Find your way from a comfortable start in a person-sized depression on the right. Head up and left vaguely following an angled crack while slightly overhung to the top of a roof/block. You can jump from the comfortable height here or go to the top of the formation up an easy low angle to the top for a higher jump. Shallower towards the right. Plenty deep where the climb goes.The pinch and surrounding holds can get really hot in the sun.
content.location: In the cove just past/upstream of Chloe's Tree. This is also just past/upstream where a dry river intersects the creek.GPS: 34.962542,-110.659294

content.description: An easy way for newer Deep Water Soloists to get up high. This route climbs the arete right next to Oil Slick, and offers a more straightforward way to reach the top of the feature. The crux is the first or second move off the raft, followed quickly by a full body rest and an easy (5.6ish) romp to the top
content.protection: DWS S1: Almost always good water depth, an unlikely slip on the easy terrain could be dangerous if falling to climbers right, fall left when possible.
content.location: Just past the large angled "diving platform" on the right. There should be a small pullout onto the rocks on the left if you would like to set up camp for the day.

content.description: Fun climbing up  jet black patina'ed rock face. The patina is broken down low giving a somewhat interesting, but secure start. As you climb, the patina shows less sign of weathering. Near the top the holds turn to sidepulls and give you a little puzzle near the top. Easily one of the more fun, but tall moderates in the canyon, and with a shorter than usual paddle-approach
content.protection: DWS S0 : Deep water well below the fall zone almost always.
content.location: Right side of the canyon paddling up the canyon from the boat-launch. Just past a large diving board like feature on the right that many visitors will use for cliff jumping. On the left of the canyon you'll pass a small area where you could set up camp for the day, hard to see the patina'ed face until you're at it or past it.

content.description: Straight up this one do not wander right and fall on the rock. Do not wander left to climb  the crack. Crimps to under clings and side pulls to more crimps to shallow sloppy one or two finger pockets and then the sloper fest starts for ten more feet to the top.
content.protection: Just right of the 5.11 crack is a thin powerful face climb. Be sure to scope the landing there is a rock just right of the line if you fall straight you will be okay. The line sits between the crack and the under water rock.
content.location: Back the clear will be table roof. It sits about 15 ft  tall off the water on your right head up another 200 yards to the project wall and the 5.11 crack and this around the side.

content.description: This test of balance is a great warm up for classic V4 Nice Guys Finish Last.
content.location: just to the left of Nice Guys Finish Last.

content.description: Great low crux for those who have super pinch strength and a sustained bit of rock climbing follows.
content.location: About a mile upstream on the right hand side

content.description: Classic must do confidence builder for the microwave
content.location: a mile up stream on the right just past the microwave

content.description: Fun overhanging jug hall with a very fun crux at the top
content.location: about 2 miles back on you right if your heading up stream just up from the short classic 5.9 crack

content.protection: Deep water - **Small risk of decking on a the narrow starter platform (pictured) on the first 2-3 easy/secure layback moves. It's semi submerged, slanted and relatively small.
content.location: At the beginning of the creek, just after "Yeah Buddy 5.12". Unfortunately lots of grafiti including a large turtle above it.

content.description: A nice 11a water solo across the creek from the 45 degree(Bump to Conclublahblah). Wander right to a seam/crack system and follow to a ledge at 40ft. Sustained with some crafty sequences.
content.location: Across from Bump to Conclusions, just a couple oar strokes downstream.

content.description: Fun Climb starts on a positive triangle and a right hand mono with good feet up to an side pull that you fall into off the fun shapes your on.
content.location: Mile and a 1/4 up stream on the right

content.description: Fun warm up climb as you are heading deeper into the canyon.  There are a few good options for jumping off, and you can keep going quite high if you're interested in getting some more air time.  Starts just left of the tree and goes pretty much straight up.
content.location: On the right side of the creek if you are heading from the park/bridge.  This climb will be before a lot of the established routes as you are heading deeper into the canyon.  It is located about 200 yards before the big diving board (also on the right).  Unfortunately, at the time of this post, you can spot the climb by some graffiti at the base and the top.

content.description: Look for the "bear claw" pockets at the start of the route. Climb straight up through varnished scoops that lead you under the capstone. Once under the cap, move left onto the exposed white rock with black varnish features for the last ten feet or so. Top out left of the summit cap.
content.protection: This is a deep water solo.
content.location: Mid way up canyon on the right hand(going upstream) wall.

content.description: Boating upstream from McHood Park, the rock climbs on your right side will be listed here in the West Side. The first outstanding climb - Yeah Buddy - is on the right side. Not a great warm up, but by the time you get back there at the end of the day you'll be too spent from cranking, paddling and swimming all day to have the motivation for it. Get on it now if it's on you're list. Other West Side classics further upstream and not to be missed are Full Value, Bear Claw, and Last Day of Summer.
